Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: `getdatafromblock` RPC is working just about perfectly.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you can even call it out of order on any block. The function got complicated after adding onto it for a couple of days.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but I saved having to track things on sync...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the 1 RPC call dos everything

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: https://github.com/StakedChain/komodo/blob/streamer_recv/src/rpcblockchain.cpp#L285

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Last thing to verify is the 3 lots of data I sent are received exactly as sent... I cant see why they wont be, as early tests on the splitting algos etc all lined up and data cannot get lost in a blockchain.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
Mate just called me, hes in town for his bday so will be heading out ... 
Not aure whats up with that pool. the errors look like the RPC info is wrong maybe ?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
example output of RPC using `false` so there is no hex string:
```./komodo-cli -ac_name=TEST2 getdatafromblock 140 false
{
  "streamid": "test2",
  "firsttxid": "fb0d0daa13dfb481a4018fe74137ca513eb5b2e52e0b154d66b1baee6fd7e4aa",
  "firstblockheight": 137,
  "firstseqid": 718,
  "lastseqid": 956
}
```

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Guess next step here is to make a python dAPP to tie it all together so you can send a file and reassemble it back into a file as its being received via blocknotify.

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: Trying to catch up on all the things ive missed...

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: @Alright i saw you asked about a use case for a chain with on demand blocks and no rewards... I brought this up before one night

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: Using multiple chains to store single records sets of specfic data to a unique chain like how a database is structured in tables for certain record types.

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: Example is Point of Sale retail data

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: its transactional

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: One write command of multiple tables/chains of data like CUSTINFO, ITEMINFO, REQUESTEDDELIVERYDATE, ACCOUNTRECEIVABLES, PURCHASEORDERDETAILS etc etc

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: When our system writes a sale it touches no less than 12 MSSQL tables and then at least 8 tables in an older parent DB that maintains Accounting Ledgers

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: The use case would be a super lightweight hardware footprint that could be placed in every store to cache and relay the singular purchase transactions to the different chains so other services could run their own node anywhere they want and with proper keys to decrypt the data, parse it and use it for whatever other tasks or 3rd party service providers

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: Making it a super light weight way to replicate and distribute the data and have a guaranteed backup of that data

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: It would also make it super compatible to any frontend just passing the needed JSON and on demand block creation features

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: and this method could utilize CCs to accomplish most if not all of the work like a set of stored procedures in MSSQL.

Author: blackjok3r#3181

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: On demand blocks

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Block time can be a low as a couple of seconds

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Can put any data as a hexsyring into it and fetch all the data per block

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Pretty mad

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: OK the only issiue I see is the way that the data is saved

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: its a TxBlaster that has a setable timout

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Currently you can only stream 1 file at a time using it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: how fast can you stream data?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: 2MB every couple of seconds

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: maybe faster if you sent it in larger chunks

Author: Alright#0419
Content: well that 2mb includes the block and txs

Author: Alright#0419
Content: yes?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: No

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you send 2MB to the marketmaker

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so why 2mb a second?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and it floods tx

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: thats just what I tried so far

Author: Alright#0419
Content: every couple of*

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I will try 10MB a second today and see if it works

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It has a sleep, of 1s every 1s until it sees data then it sends it

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: each time you send data RPC to add to queue

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: as soon as its added it sends the whole lot

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: But the limitation is, that you can only send 1 stream at a time

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: ts single threaded

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: saving each chain in real time, would simply not work

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so if what you're streaming is larger than block size, it streams it all at once then 2mb is confirmed at a time?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It will just stay in mempool

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: each block has 241 txs

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: with 8kb chunk in each

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: But pulling all the txs was too slow

Author: Alright#0419
Content: is it confirmed in order?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: So I made an rpc that connects all the data togeter in a block and returns it as 1 peice

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: each tx takes the change of the last tx

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so they have to be in order

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so far nothig has been out of order

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: there is an error check for that

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but its never activated so far
